perturbation.original_text: Licensee shall use commercially reasonable efforts to exploit the rights granted hereunder throughout the world (the "Territory"), including without limitation all of the following VGSL Territories set forth in Paragraph 2(c)(i)(B) above: (1) United Kingdom; (2) Ireland; (3) Germany; (4) Spain; (5) France; (6) Sweden; (7) Switzerland; (8) Portugal; (9) Netherlands; (10) Greece; (11) Italy; (12) Australia; (13) New Zealand; (14) Egypt; (15) Slovenia; (16) Belgium; (17) Austria; (18) Hungary; (19) Malta; (20) Croatia; (21) South Africa; and (22) Japan. Licensee shall localize the Wireless Products into the following languages: English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, and Japanese. In addition to the previously stated languages, to the extent practicable Licensee also shall localize the Wireless Products to be delivered to VGSL into Portuguese, Greek, Dutch and Swedish, to the extent that the Properties
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee shall use commercially reasonable efforts to exploit the rights granted hereunder throughout the world (the "Territory"), including without limitation all of the following VGSL Territories set forth in Paragraph 2(c)(i)(B) above: (1) United Kingdom; (2) Ireland; (3) Germany; (4) Spain; (5) France; (6) Sweden; (7) Switzerland; (8) Portugal; (9) Netherlands; (10) Greece; (11) Italy; (12) Australia; (13) New Zealand; (14) Egypt; (15) Slovenia; (16) Belgium; (17) Austria; (18) Hungary; (19) Malta; (20) Croatia; (21) South Africa; and (22) Japan. Licensee is only required to localize the Wireless Products into the following languages: English. In addition to the previously stated languages, to the extent not practicable Licensee does not have to localize the Wireless Products to be delivered to VGSL into Portuguese, Greek, Dutch and Swedish, to the extent that the Properties
perturbation.explanation: The original contract mandated localization into multiple languages, whereas the modified version restricts it to English only, with an added clause suggesting other localizations are unnecessary. This creates an in-text contradiction regarding the languages into which the Wireless Products must be localized, leading to uncertainty in enforcement. This affects Licensee's distribution obligations.

perturbation.original_text: Notwithstanding Paragraph 15(b), in the event of termination of this Agreement, Licensee shall have a period of ***** from the date of such termination (unless such termination occurs less than ***** prior to the expiration of this Agreement in which case the time period shall be shortened accordingly so as not to exceed the date of expiration) in which to sell-off existing inventory of Wireless Products already in the Distribution Channels ("Sell Off Period"). Licensee agrees that no additional Wireless Products may be developed or distributed during the Sell Off Period and Licensee agrees to require that any Licensed CSP to comply with this provision. Upon the expiration of the Sell Off Period, Licensee agrees to destroy all such remaining inventory and confirm same in writing to Fox (and require that any Licensed CSP do the same). Any revenues, credits or other consideration received by Licensee for the Wireless Products during the Sell Off Period will be subject to Licensee's obligation to pay Fox Royalties pursuant to Paragraph 7 above.
perturbation.changed_text: Notwithstanding Paragraph 15(b), in the event of termination of this Agreement, Licensee shall have a period of ***** from the date of such termination (unless such termination occurs less than ***** prior to the expiration of this Agreement in which case the time period shall be shortened accordingly so as not to exceed the date of expiration) in which to sell-off existing inventory of Wireless Products already in the Distribution Channels ("Sell Off Period"). Licensee is allowed to continue to develop, distribute and sell Wireless Products during the Sell Off Period. Upon the expiration of the Sell Off Period, Licensee may decide to destroy all such remaining inventory. Any revenues, credits or other consideration received by Licensee for the Wireless Products during the Sell Off Period will not be subject to Licensee's obligation to pay Fox Royalties pursuant to Paragraph 7 above.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract stipulated a sell-off period after termination, prohibiting further development or distribution, and mandating the destruction of remaining inventory with royalties still applicable. The modified version allows continued development and distribution, makes inventory destruction optional, and removes the royalty obligation during this period. This creates a contradiction regarding Licensee's rights and obligations post-termination, making enforcement ambiguous.

perturbation.original_text: For the Term of this Agreement, Fox hereby grants to Licensee a right of first negotiation with respect to those theatrical motion pictures released during the Term of this Agreement (in addition to the Properties identified in Exhibit A) in which (i) Fox owns or controls licensing and merchandising rights, for which Fox determines in its sole discretion to grant to any third party any licensing rights for the development and distribution of wireless products, and (ii) which theatrical motion pictures Fox reasonably deems to be a Major Release consistent with its past practices. The Right of First Negotiation shall be exercised as follows. Whenever Fox desires to grant to any third party any licensing rights for a Major Release (each such instance, an "Opportunity"), Fox shall request that Licensee submit a bid regarding the Opportunity. If Licensee intends to exercise its Right of First Negotiation, it must submit a bid in response to Fox's request within 10 business days.
perturbation.changed_text: For the Term of this Agreement, Fox may or may not grant to Licensee a right of first negotiation with respect to those theatrical motion pictures released during the Term of this Agreement (in addition to the Properties identified in Exhibit A) in which (i) Fox owns or controls licensing and merchandising rights, for which Fox determines in its sole discretion to grant to any third party any licensing rights for the development and distribution of wireless products, and (ii) which theatrical motion pictures Fox reasonably deems to be a Major Release consistent with its past practices. The Right of First Negotiation shall be exercised as Fox sees fit. Whenever Fox desires to grant to any third party any licensing rights for a Major Release (each such instance, an "Opportunity"), Fox shall request that Licensee may submit a bid regarding the Opportunity. If Licensee intends to exercise its Right of First Negotiation, it may submit a bid in response to Fox's request whenever it feels like it.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract grants Licensee a 'right of first negotiation,' which mandates Fox to request a bid from Licensee before granting rights to a third party. The modified version introduces uncertainty by stating Fox 'may or may not grant' this right, and changes the 'must submit' to 'may submit a bid whenever it feels like it', giving Fox absolute discretion on whether to engage with Licensee. This creates conflict regarding Licensee's right of first negotiation, making it unclear if Fox is bound to offer these opportunities. This affects new business opportunities and revenue projections.
